# Java - Java Deployment and Best Practices

<span class="lead"> </span>

<span id="Deployment"></span>

**At the end of this module, you should be able to:**

-   convert our JAVA Spring applications from using H2 to using PostgreSQL
-   deploy to a cloud service a full RESTful Web Services application with a JAR using PostgreSQL, Maven, Spring including Spring Boot, and Tomcat
-   connect to a JavaScript Frontend to authenticate to a Java Spring Application including determining authenticated users information
-   use CURL to perform CRUD operations using a Spring Application
-   understand what else a Java programmer should know
-   locally deploy a full RESTful Web Services application with a JAR using PostgreSQL, Maven, Spring including Spring Boot, and Tomcat (\*\*\* OPTIONAL \*\*\*)

#### Pro Tip

Applying to jobs can be a numbers game. The more you network and apply, the better your odds.

## <a href="#prepare" id="prepare" class="anchor"><span class="octicon octicon-link"></span></a>Prepare

Review each preclass resource before class.

#### Learn to understand what else a Java programmer should know

<span id="Future_Java_Topics"></span>

##### Overview

The Java Unit you are completing

-   gives you a solid foundation in Java and the Spring Framework including a good foundation upon which to build future knowledge.
-   prepares you for being a backend developer for Lambda School’s Build Projects and Labs.
-   covers just over half of the topics that interest our hiring partners.

To be a successful Java Backend developer, you will need to continue your Java Spring Framework studies. Below are topics gathered from several hiring partners, topics that we ran out of time to cover in the Java Course. The topics are roughly in order of importance, that is how often employers said they wished for someone who knew the topics. Lambda School is committed to providing a high-quality thorough education enabling you to obtain the best possible job! We are working on creating our own materials to cover these topics. Until they are available I have provided some external resources that you can use as a good starting point for studying the given topic. As always, do feel free to reach out to your instructions and fellow students for help!

Note that not all topics are the same. Learning about immutability and final might take an hour or so. Learning AWS could easily be a full Lambda School unit. Good Luck and keep learning!!!

### Java Specific Topics

-   Types of Lambda Expressions: Supplier, Consumer, Predicate, Function Interfaces
    -   [Functional Interfaces in Java 8](https://www.baeldung.com/java-8-functional-interfaces)
-   immutability and final
    -   [Geeks for Geeks Final vs Immutability](https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/final-vs-immutability-java/)
-   Enum Types
    -   [Jenkov Enums](http://tutorials.jenkov.com/java/enums.html)
-   Linked List
    -   [LinkedList in Java with Example](https://beginnersbook.com/2013/12/linkedlist-in-java-with-example/)
-   Wrappers, Generics, Optionals
    -   [Time To Really Learn Generics: A Java 8 Perspective](https://nofluffjuststuff.com/magazine/2016/09/time_to_really_learn_generics_a_java_8_perspective)
-   Iterators especially manipulating iterators during iteration
    -   [Jenkov Java Iterator](http://tutorials.jenkov.com/java-collections/iterator.html)
-   File I/O
    -   [Tutorial Point File IO](https://www.tutorialspoint.com/java/java_files_io.htm)
-   Streams
    -   [Jenkov Streams](http://tutorials.jenkov.com/java-functional-programming/streams.html)
-   Memory Management
    -   stack and heap
        -   [Java Heap Space vs. Stack Memory: How Java Applications Allocate Memory including links on page](https://stackify.com/java-heap-vs-stack/)
        -   [Stack Memory and Heap Space in Java](https://www.baeldung.com/java-stack-heap)
    -   passed by value or reference
        -   [Does Java pass by reference or pass by value?](https://www.javaworld.com/article/3512039/does-java-pass-by-reference-or-pass-by-value.html)
-   TDD
    -   [Udemy Practical Test Driven Development for Java Programmers](https://www.udemy.com/course/practical-test-driven-development-for-java-programmers/)
    -   [A Book: Test Driven](https://www.manning.com/books/test-driven)
-   Development, Testing, Production environment separation (Maven Driven)
    -   [Spring Boot Profiles for DEV and PROD Environments](https://stackabuse.com/spring-boot-profiles-for-dev-and-prod-environments/)
-   Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery (Jenkins)
    -   [Jenkins Tutorial: Build a Java app with Maven](https://www.jenkins.io/doc/tutorials/build-a-java-app-with-maven/)
-   WAR File Distribution
    -   [How to Deploy a WAR File to Tomcat](https://www.baeldung.com/tomcat-deploy-war)
-   Class Diagram including translating into Java Code
    -   [Unified Modeling Language (UML) And Following Pages](https://www.tutorialspoint.com/uml/index.htm)
    -   [UML: from theory to practice including information on IntelliJ](https://codegym.cc/groups/posts/uml-diagram-java)
-   Design Patterns
    -   [Journal Dev Design Patterns](https://www.journaldev.com/1827/java-design-patterns-example-tutorial)
-   Aspect Programming
    -   [Aspect Oriented Programming with Spring 4.0 but an easier read](https://docs.spring.io/spring/docs/4.3.14.RELEASE/spring-framework-reference/html/aop.html)
    -   [Aspect Oriented Programming with Spring 5.0](https://docs.spring.io/spring/docs/current/spring-framework-reference/core.html#aop)
    -   [Spring AOP Tutorial and following pages](https://www.javatpoint.com/spring-aop-tutorial)

### Database Specific Topics

-   Threads - runnable, blocked, waiting, terminated. concurrency, race conditions
    -   [Jenkov - Section on Concurrency](http://tutorials.jenkov.com/java-concurrency/index.html)
-   In-Memory Caching
    -   [Spring Framework Guru: Using Ehcache 3 in Spring Boot](https://springframework.guru/using-ehcache-3-in-spring-boot/)
-   Metrics from emission to expiration (for example see CloudWatch)
    -   [Amazon CloudWatch User Guide](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/WhatIsCloudWatch.html)
    -   [Spring Boot Actuator: Production-ready Features](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current/reference/html/production-ready-features.html)
-   Performance
    -   [50 Best Performance Practices for Hibernate 5](https://dzone.com/articles/50-best-performance-practices-for-hibernate-5-amp)
-   AWS
    -   Check first to see if Lambda School has anything available if not try
    -   [Amazon Web Services (AWS) Certified - 4 Certifications!](https://www.udemy.com/course/aws-certified-associate-architect-developer-sysops-admin/)
    -   [AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner: 6 Full Practice Exams 2020](https://www.udemy.com/course/aws-certified-cloud-practitioner-practice-test/)
    -   [Introducing the AWS Cloud Architect Nanodegree Program from Udacity](https://blog.udacity.com/2020/05/introducing-the-aws-cloud-architect-nanodegree-program-from-udacity.html)

### API Specific Topics

-   Logging
    -   [Logback Documentation](http://logback.qos.ch/documentation.html)
    -   [SLF4J: Different Log Files for Different Log Levels](http://mbcoder.com/slf4j-different-log-files-for-different-log-levels/)
    -   [Spring Boot Actuator](https://www.baeldung.com/spring-boot-actuators)
    -   [Logback Introduction: An Enterprise Logging Framework](https://springframework.guru/logback-enterprise-logging-framework-2/)
    -   [Logging in Spring Boot](https://www.baeldung.com/spring-boot-logging)
-   Remote Debugging
    -   [Spring Debugging](https://www.baeldung.com/spring-debugging)
    -   [Debug Spring boot application from remote server](https://javadeveloperzone.com/spring-boot/debug-spring-boot-application-from-remote-server/)
-   API Design Considerations
    -   [Best Practices for Designing a Pragmatic RESTful API](https://www.vinaysahni.com/best-practices-for-a-pragmatic-restful-api)
    -   [Architectural Styles and the Design of Network-based Software Architectures](https://www.ics.uci.edu/~fielding/pubs/dissertation/top.htm)
    -   [API Stylebook](http://apistylebook.com/)
    -   [More Design Resources!](https://techbeacon.com/app-dev-testing/guide-restful-api-design-35-must-reads)
-   Queuing / execution background services / Executor Services / Futures / Thread Safety
    -   [Introduction to Spring Boot Scheduler](https://www.javadevjournal.com/spring-boot/spring-boot-scheduler/)
    -   [Java 101: Understanding Java threads, Part 1: Introducing threads and runnables and following](https://www.javaworld.com/article/2074217/java-101--understanding-java-threads--part-1--introducing-threads-and-runnables.html)
-   Message Queuing (RabbitMQ)
    -   [Scale Your Application With Spring and RabbitMQ including the Further Reading Links](https://dzone.com/articles/scale-your-application-with-spring-and-rabbitmq)
-   Microservices
    -   [Udemy: Spring Boot Microservices with Spring Cloud Beginner to Guru](https://www.udemy.com/course/spring-boot-microservices-with-spring-cloud-beginner-to-guru/)

### General Education Resources

If you prefer full courses instead of individual topics, these are for you!

#### Video Courses

-   [Coursera Object Oriented Programming in Java Specialization - or any course part of this specialization!](https://www.coursera.org/specializations/object-oriented-programming)
-   [Udemy Java Programming Masterclass for Software Developers (around $10.00)](https://www.udemy.com/java-the-complete-java-developer-course)
-   [Building Cloud Services with the Java Spring Framework](https://www.coursera.org/learn/cloud-services-java-spring-framework)
-   [Building Scalable Java Microservices with Spring Boot and Spring Cloud](https://www.coursera.org/learn/google-cloud-java-spring)
-   [THE online course in Database Design. This is video 1 of the series](https://www.edx.org/course/databases-1-introduction-to-relational-databases)

#### Books

-   [Java Methods - my go to book for Core Java](http://www.skylit.com/jm.html)
-   [Spring REST - code dated but set the foundation for Java Spring](https://www.amazon.com/Spring-REST-Balaji-Varanasi/dp/1484208242)
-   [Effective Java - THE book on writing effective Java Code](https://www.amazon.com/Effective-Java-Joshua-Bloch-ebook/dp/B078H61SCH)
-   [Data Structures and Algorithms in Java](https://www.amazon.com/Data-Structures-Algorithms-Java-6th-ebook/dp/B00JDRQF8C/)
-   [Apress: Spring Boot Persistence Best Practices](https://www.apress.com/us/book/9781484256251)
-   [Database Systems - The Complete Book](https://www.amazon.com/Database-Systems-Complete-Hector-Garcia-Molina-ebook-dp-B009TGBW58/dp/B009TGBW58/)

You can use class recordings to help you master the material.

### Demonstrate Mastery

To demonstrate mastery of this module, you need to complete and pass a code review on each of the following:

-   Guided Project: Spring Foundation
-   Project: Deploy Shopping Cart
